intro: Leptochilus oblongus, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
